intro: Brachyotum quinquenerve var. pusillum, commonly known as the small-veined brachyotum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves with five prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a modest amount of nectar that attracts pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecological niche.
